description:
This place is legit. I usually don't review a place until I've been there a few times, but this was definitely worthy of some kind words. 

Had a long day of walking around the zoo with my daughter and this place is conveniently located across the street. There are only 3 tables in the tiny dining room, but there's a cool outdoor counter along the window ledge outside. It's also really warm in there, but that wasn't gonna stop us. The sausage goes on raw and is just super fresh. Nicely laid out on a layer of sliced mozzarella. Each bite was incredibly juicy and the crust was awesome. When I come back, I'm definitely gonna dive into some seafood pizza. Can't wait to try those clams. 

Great job guys, I'll see you next time
author: Mark F.

description:
This Pasquale's location has been around since I was a kid, so that's at least about 40 years (not that I wanted to date myself). I thought to swing by after visiting the folks and ordered a medium - half cheese and the other pepperoni. Just for the longevity (and sure because I'm a nostalgic kind a guy, who misses the Doggie Diner once nearby), I give points for this Pasquale's. 

This place also hasn't changed its look much - if at all - since my childhood days in the Outer Sunset, so more points for that. In addition, this joint has a no-frills decor and still uses an old cash register though credit cards are accepted. 

Now for the pizza: It had the right amount of cheese, didn't skimp on the pepperoni and had a good chewy though not doughy crust and bread. Bottom line, my family liked it a lot, and that's all that really mattered.
author: Neil G.

description:
We came to stay in San Francisco to go to the zoo. 
This pizza place is right next door to the hotel we are staying at. 

At first we were turned off because they didnt have multiple items on the menu that we were ordering. So, we just decided to grab a pizza and a meatball sandwich. 

The meatball sandwich was phenom!!! Piping hot and the perfect amounts of sauce, cheese and meatballs. 

The pizza was fabulous! We ordered the House Special.  Loved the fact that it was old world itilian thin crust. Crispy, firm slices, and loaded with toppings. Comes with cheese, pepperoni,  salami, and white mushrooms.  Not so loaded down that the pizza sagged. It was perfect.

I would recommend as long as you ask what they have  available for the day  first.
author: Ashley W.

description: This pizza is the best around, and their staff is great at this location. We've eaten at their other location for years, but we live near this location, and decided to stop after going to the zoo. We had a family of 9 with us, and let us put the tables together. The pizza was amazing, just like their other location, and the staff was super accommodating and polite. We're going to be ordering to go pizza from here or continuing to dine in at their other location. This is some of the best pizza for a family (or anyone) in SF.
author: Angela T.

description:
We have been ordering from this place for many years now and I have to say the pizza's are super delicious & affordable. 

I gave it 4 stars only because the place just needs a little bit of cleaning and has so little space for you to eat inside. Customer service couple of times was bad when asking for it to be delivered. The man that took my order sounded as if he didnt love his job very much. But despite of all that delivery service is timely and dependable.

One of my favorites that my family & friends generally always order is the XL extra mushroom pizza. Hand tossed thin crust and great non pizza chain taste. So much flavor and cooked perfectly just the way we wanted. I highly recommend the place and will continue to definitly order more pizza's from this place.
author: Len A.

description: you know the pizza is good when  it's all about the sauce. I got thin crust meat lovers.
author: Honey H.

description: My go to delivery pizza! Very quick and convenient and super delicious! The mixed green salad is always really fresh...definitely recommend if ordering to go as the Sloat location is rather small for dining in.
author: Meghan L.

description:
So I came in at sunset. After a group of girls  ordered before me so the boys were less enthused to deal with me. The wild crazy eyed cashier one at the register had two simple jobs to do. Take my order and take my money, properly. That's the key. So as I told him what I wanted "medium half combination half pepperoni and olives"  

well he couldn't do those jobs right. 

Ok he says. Rights it down. 

What size, x large? 

No I said medium. As he runs the gals credit card and puts the slip in front of me but says it's for them. 

What size he asks. 

I say " for the third time medium" 
He says ok I got it

Then I get the bill and its 24.88 for a 21 dollar medium combination 
So as I pay I ask why it's more than a medium Combo. He says I added olives. It's a extra topping for 175. But it and pepperoni are on the combo. So I hold my breath. Pay. And wait as the boys now say not nice things, in Spanish, about me questioning their tallying methods. . The lumpy cook could not stop glaring which made me look closely at what he was doing and it looked like there wasnt any pepperoni on the pep olive side so I waited 

Then the boss came back from doing deliveries and heard an earful of crap from his employee about how I'm questioning the process and the boss tells the line cook to shut the hell up and make the pizzas. That "Nobody" like me the customer "wants to hear (his) opinion". So at least the boss put that out there to him but when the pizza came out of the oven it was wrong. Half combo with just olives on the other side so I told him how he listened so amazingly  I didn't say he ripped me off for topping I paid for. And then didn't fulfill the order because he was too distracted by women and not able to take an order. It was real slow. Nobody was ordering. Should've been a great experience they make great pizza when they care. But these three guys didn't care.
author: Rick B.

description:
I USED to regularly order from this place. However, over the past few months the customer service has been less than stellar. In fact, it has gotten so bad, that they should sell rudeness with pizza on the side. 

I understand and can appreciate an establishment bring extraordinarily busy, but seriously, hanging up on  a caller 5 times in a row is ridiculous. I HAD planned on placing an order for a pizza take out tonight and a FIVE pizza delivery for Thursday. No guesswork here, I'm taking my business elsewhere and for good!

Oh, and when I asked to speak with the manager about their shoddy customer service, I got the same jerk who initially answered the call pretending to be the manager. I wouldn't be surprised if they spit on the pizza or flicked a bugger on it out of spite. 

If I could give them zero stars, I would.
author: Sana N.

description:
Wow! Pasquale's on Sloat has been going down hill for decades but have now really hit rock bottom! Absolutely disgusting nearly inedible swirl/slop at this point! I have been dining and ordering from various Pasquale's my entire 48 year life and have been frequenting Pasquale's with my family since before I can even remember, but there is a huge difference between the two remaining restaurants, the main one on Irving and this dive spot on Sloat. 

I recently had a birthday and turned 48 and it was the first birthday in my life when I didn't at least meet up with family or friends on my special day, so feeling pretty bummed out that I had absolutely no plans for lunch, brunch or dinner on my actual birthday, decided to treat myself to some comfort food by myself. Called in to order a small two topping pizza for pickup; I save about 5 or 6 bucks on delivery fee and tip by driving about a mile away so I opted to call in my order and pick it up; to which I was told "20 minutes." 

I showed up exactly 20 minutes later and my pizza wasn't ready. Big mistake on their behalf, because it gave me time to just stand there, look around and realize just how dirty, rundown and grimy this shack is. I never noticed how poor the integrity of the tiny building that looks like it could be brought down by one pass of a bulldozer is. pacing around for 10 minutes waiting for my pizza and looking around at nothing to really look at, what immediately stood out to me is that there were flies EVERYWHERE!!! The ingredients were uncovered and the two guys there didn't give half a crap. They were flying around the air and crawling over food behind  the counter; just gross! The place just looked gross and made me wonder about other times I had ordered from here and felt sick in the past. 

The two guys working that night looked like they were somewhere between 18 and 20 and had no clue of how to make pizza! Making good pizza is actually an art with a science to it and requires some degree of taught skill. kneading the dough, tossing the dough, adding the right amount of olive oil, distributing the ingredients and cooking and toasting the pizza is all part of the process of making a good pizza. These guys just throw everything on the thick dough with no thought or skill to it at all, cook your pizza and put it in a b ox. It also smelled bad in the restaurant while I waited for ten minutes and on the way home the pizza actually smelled bad and I dreaded eating it, instead of when I used to bring a pizza from Pasquale's home, smelling the tempting aroma from the olive oil and other ingredients, just disgusted me. I almost wanted to throw it out, but I never waste money and hoped that it would taste good. .. Nope! tasted awful as well and just put the finishing insult to injury on one of my worst birthdays to date. 

I have never written or talked about this and this was long before Yelp and it's most likely under different management and staff but 25-30 years ago, I ordered a pizza from Sloat; clearly asked for a medium pizza with salami on the whole pizza and mushrooms on half of it and got a cheese pizza with mushrooms on one half which just didn't do it for me. I called to complain and the scuzbag who answered the phone said "I can give you back a dollar for one ingredient; I should have argued to make me a whole new pizza or reimburse me for half but was young and just said "well okay I guess" the guy I had tipped a dollar; that's how much you tipped back then, showed up to my door looking like he wanted to rip my head off! and handed me a dollar! I know that the loser cook or manager told the kid that I wanted my tip back! That never sat well with me as not only did the cook on the phone screw up my order and ruined my pizza and then only offered a dollar back, but also told the poor delivery boy to drive way out of his way because I wanted my tip back! What a POS that guy was, back then. 

Anyway, I will never under any circumstances ever come back or order from Pasquale's on Sloat again. Pasquale's on Irving has also declined a bit but is a million times better than the one on Sloat. Never again on Sloat, never again.
author: David A.

description: I used to get the pizza at USF when I was a student.   That location burnt down.  Tried the one on Sloat.  Very good.  Had a feta and garlic and a Mediterranean.  Family has a new pizza place!
author: Barb L.

description: This place is the best I've had! Quality ingredients, perfectly crafted pizza, on time and so reasonably priced given their deliciousness! Their menu is truly all I need, and I will always make a point to come here if I'm any where near the Bay Area! So good I have to share!
author: Jeani K.

description: I was here at 9:20pm and they were closed. 3 guys in the shop looking and shrugging. Thanks for nothing
author: Makena R.

description:
Do I care that my SO calls this place P'squalor after finding a hair in her slice?
Do I care that I always get the mean mug from the rotund pie slinger behind the counter?
Do I care that the nearest one to me is across the bridge and on the south end of SF, making this at least an hour drive even at the best time for traffic?

No.
No.
And no.

This pie is real SF. 
It's the Sunset district. 
It's Doggy Diner and that tiger that mauled that idiot kid at the zoo. 
It's so f'ing SF that no amount of progressive politics would allow you to understand. 

And I don't give 2 sh!ts what any of these other reviewers have to say.
This place has been here forever and will be.
When real Sunset kids dream of pizza, what they smell is a large extra garlic house pie from Pasquale's.

Pasquale's for life.
author: John C.

description:
I was in San Francisco for 8 months for work. I wish I had known about this place back then! Best pizza in San Francisco. Trust me, I know, I looked for a good pizza place for 8 months! The guys behind the counter are personable, the place is small, but was very busy when I went in. I actually walked down to the beach and enjoyed the sunset for about an hour waiting for the place to calm down. The pizza was really, really good. I'm staying in the same hotel in December and will be enjoying another one of these fantastic pizzas. 

The only thing I can say about them as a criticism is that the small pizza is to big for one person. It would be nice if they would make a smaller personal size, maybe for or five pieces. Although, the cold pizza I had for breakfast was still very good!

Also, I had the salad and it was VERY fresh. But, WAY WAY to many onions and peppers. The salad dressing just tasted like oil, not much flavor to it.
author: Susan B.

description:
Terrible customer service. Ordered pizza for delivery, they quoted an hour after giving my address. Waited an hour and a half. Called in to check on the order, and was told that they don't deliver to my address. If that was the case, why wasn't I informed? Absolutely terrible. Would rate zero stars if I could. 

Ps. I've ordered from this location before and they've delivered to my address before. So I don't really understand what happened. If the policy changed then fine. Just let me know instead of wasting my time.
author: Mikes N.

description: I love this pizza spot, been going here since '87. Sausage, salami, olive, and mushroom.
author: A B.

description: Definitely a fan of this place. Went here on my way back to the East bay when I wanted to avoid traffic. Me and my brother went to hang at the beach and grabbed something to eat while we waited. We ordered a tomato and cheese pizza and it was pretty good. We went in to eat in the restaurant, and mind you, it's pretty tiny inside. There's just three tables but luckily we were able grab one. The pizza was made on the spot and was pretty much everything you need from a pizza. I found the crust to be crisp enough to hold all the pizza, and since we ate it right as it came out it didn't end up being soggy. There was also quite the amount of cheese which was great! This pizza and a beer was a great combo. Will be back again when I'm in the area.
author: Jessica F.

description: I have been going to Pasquale's since the 60's. First Irving street and when they opened Sloat. The quality of the Pizza has always been good. However,  the last time I was in the Sloat store (March 2017)it was dirty with hundreds of flies swarming around the store. Nobody seemed to care about the situation. The employees did not even bother to cover the toppings to keep the flies off. Sorry Sloat store, you won't see me no more. When I have the craving I will go to Irving street instead. They run a clean store. Not a fly sanctuary.
author: Odysseus N.

description: Good pizza for the kids. Ordered takeout for a little league game. Straight forward pies from a neighborhood institution. Gotta keep these places alive!
author: Emily G.

description: Favorite Neighborhood Pizza...going there for 30 years...best combos and service is quick in pick up
author: Dianne A.

description: When I get out of work late and it's too late to cook, I can always count on these guys to make our favorite pizza! I live close by, so it's most convenient to drive by and pick up my order on the way home. I love thick crust and garlic, so we get that on every pizza, whether that be garlic/pepperoni or garlic/sausage. Aaron and Mario are awesome! :) They usually finish the pizza before the time they estimate too.
author: Erika C.

description:
Okay, its not the fanciest place by any stretch of the means. But for whatever it lacks in ambience, this place more than makes up for it in taste and quality of service in spades!!! 

We ordered a cheese pizza with mushrooms and tomatoes. One small pizza was enough to feed the two of us and then some! They were such nice people here. We felt right at home. They're in a great location by the beach and across the street from the SF zoo. Perfect place to stop at before heading off to do other fun activities. 

The bathroom is small and clean. It could use some updating, but the fact that they let us use one at all was very accomadating. 

I liked coming here, and I'll definitely be coming back!
author: Svetlana S.

description: Ordered a pizza and was quoted 45 min. An hour and a half later I called to check my order status and the guy on the phone tried to tell me it hadn't been an hour. I pulled up my call log and told him the exact time I ordered them he replies "its on it's way" pizza showed up cold.
author: Skeebs B.

description: I've eaten at the Irving location and loved the good. Just tried to order for delivery from the Sloat location. Not only did they put me on hold for awhile, when I tried to call back, they kept hanging up. I'm guessing they don't want business?
author: Grace M.

description: Pretty good pizza. Nice local place. Quality ingredients. Prices are a bit out of date so I knocked off 1 star they update them on here. And 1 star for not having that good of prices anymore.
author: Evan J.

description:
This place rates zero stars.  I am from New York where pizza is king.
I shared a medium pie with a friend.  The pizza is extremely thick doughed and dry as the Mojave.  No oil flowed off the slice.
I came with a big appetite and did not enjoy eating this lame pizza.  Starving would have been a better option.
The workers need an apprenticeship in making good pizza or attend pizza school. 
Hard to believe that this place actually has customers.
author: Edgar M.

description: Went here with family after zoo.  Place very small only 3 tables but pizza especially the crust was very good.
author: Gina N.

description: I haven't tried the pizza yet, but the pasta dishes are very reasonably priced and the sauces are some of the best I've ever had. The sauce alone warrants four stars. The bread is also exceptional and the portions are generous.
author: Andrew P.

description: If you don't feel like cooking and just wanna good meal, then this the place to order a pizza for pick up. Nothing fancy but a great pizza to enjoy while watching the NBA Finals in the comfort of your own home.   Go Dubs!
author: J S.

description:
In this day and age, it isn't hard to make a decent pizza.  With the advent of the recipes online, direct customer feedback, and sampling the competition, there's really no excuse for having a bad pizza.  This place can't even make a pizza that's mediocre much less good.  

First of all, the place had 3 tables and 8 chairs.  Do the math and you realize that some casual lap dancing might be required if you plan to dine.  This may be a plus on dates but not so great for other occasions.  

I ordered a pizza with 5 toppings and it came with 6.  We didn't want to wait another 15-20 mins and we were hungry after a long day at the zoo so we just took the pizza and removed the 6th topping.  Unfortunately, the 6th topping  happened to be Italian sausage that was pretty under cooked so that there was pink coloring on the larger pieces.  My family doesn't like sausage on pizza and the added hazard of uncooked pork didn't increase their excitement.  

All this was bad enough but the pizza itself isn't very good.  Not enough sauce and seasoning so it just tasted like sauteed veggies and half cooked meat on toast with cheese.  

I should have asked for a refund but I was already tired, annoyed and my family wasn't going to put up with me arguing with the pizza place for another 10 mins.  I did point out the 6th topping, that it was undercooked, etc.  They didn't care and only offered to remove the topping which I just did myself since I didn't trust what else they might do with the pizza.  I guess the free glass of Sprite they gave me was  their compensation plan.  

I decided to cut my losses and just threw the pizza out after everyone had a slice.  I did take pictures of the under cooked sausage in case there's any trouble for my family collecting the insurance should I die from the bad pork.
author: Roland C.

description:
Finally tried out these guys after living nearby my entire life, and honestly, they're not bad. Their website is a little archaic, but they're a smaller, local place, so it makes sense. Delivery took about 40 minutes, and they're pretty reasonably priced, size-wise.

They definitely skimp on the sauce, which makes me sad, but they give a decent spread of toppings (and 4 are included in the price of each size, although each additional is $2.25).

The pizza stuck to the box, not due to cheese, not really sure why, made it difficult to pry it off.

A good pizza overall, not the first place that comes to mind when craving a good pie, but an all around decent joint.
author: Claire S.

description:
My favorite pizza ever. I have been to Chicago, I have had Quad Cities' Taco Pizza. This is my number one place for pizza IN San Francisco. 
I wish I can come here all the time!
The best one that I have grown up eating is the House Special. Seriously, I have gone to the one in Irving and chatted with the chefs at a young age while eating the mots that they gave me :D! 
my fondest memories of my family was getting this pizza and going to the beach to gobble it all up!!
author: Rhoda May C.

description: The (older man) deliver driver takes it upon himself decide how much he gets tipped.  Check your card receipts!
author: Marvella W.

description: Wouldn't deliver a 2 minute drive away from my house, 1 hour before they close. Hmmmmm I hope the owner knows that his staff is throwing money away
author: AL M.

description: A little scared upon entering the place, it didn't seem the cleanest but the guys working there were nice and the pizza was pretty good. Kind of expensive for the sizes. I'll go back if ever staying here again.
author: Joe T.

description: Perfect crust, tasty sauce, and real mozzarella makes for a good authentic pizza. Not exactly NY pizza but we are in San Francisco. This is the best around.
author: Irving S.

description:
How does one cross San Francisco?  Slowly.  However,  the easiest bay-to-ocean trek is Market which turns into Portola which veers into Sloat.  (Geary is tempting but it doesn't start at the Embarcadero, so it doesn't pass that "test.")

Right before Sloat finishes up at The Great Highway and the Pacific Ocean, Pasquale's Pizza can be seen on the right, across from the SF Zoo.  This is the real deal.  This is not a celebrated touristy North Beach pizzeria, but a good honest down-to-earth pizzeria opened by a paesano in an area of the city where one is not likely to get claustrophobic because of the density and where the "air-conditioning" of the Pacific Ocean is on 24/7.  The prices are good, for SF, the pizzas are delicious, and everybody in our party was satisfied. *thinking about those mushrooms and perfect crusts of the pizzas I've eaten there*
author: Robert G.

description: My wife (Shirley from Concord) turned me on to Pasquale's 40+ yrs ago only it was the 9th Ave location. We started going to the beach location some time ago cuz the crust is way thicker and they are generous with the toppings. My wife says the workers are nice too. We frequently buy a pizza and go to the beach and eat while watching the sun set. They provide plates and forks. If we are passing thru SF we usually stop and get a pie to take home. Leftovers don't last long.
author: Bob M.

description: I love Pasquale's. The pizza is my favorite. I also really like the meatballs and sour dough bread. It's a thin to medium crust with not an excessive amount of sauce. They have a good pesto if you enjoy that. I think it's the best pizza place to order from in the sunset. If you're concerned about it taking too long you can always go in and pick it up after 15 minutes.
author: Brittny R.

description:
how are they always out of chicken!?!?

We heard that the charboiled chicken special was really good with pesto sauce.

So we tried to order it...3 times now....

first time no chicken, ordered some mushroom sausage pizza...thought we asked for pesto but got red sauce...

second time no chicken again, so got sausage, EMPHASIZED the pesto...and got it, yummy also.

third time was the charm i think? got the chicken special pesto...but think we like the red sauce more....

good pizza, small, kind of expensive....always no chicken....
author: Christine M.

description: Poor service, super dirty surprised that they haven't been shut down by health inspectors. Gave away our pizza to someone else who ordered at least 15 min after us. Didn't offer us any compensation. Will never come back. Hope health inspector visits them.
author: Sarah A.

description:
This is one of those places that is so bad you feel that it is your civic duty to write a negative Yelp review about it afterward. Most people probably come here for the same reason: they have parked nearby to go to the zoo or the beach. You walk in and notice that there are only two tables to sit at, one small table for 2 to 3 people, and one slightly larger. You'll also notice that there is no menu on display. The menus are all little print out menus.
It is a cash only place apparently. Draw your own conclusions why.
Something good is that there are free refills on soda. However, both the coke and diet coke tasted funny. My fiance thought it tasted like cleaner, I thought maybe the mix of syrup was off.
The pizza took a good 25 minutes to make even though there were hardly any customers. Finally I went up and asked where our pizza was and the guy said it had been ready. I wish he could have told us, because we were sitting there at the table a long time, and since they had so few customers in such a small space it shouldn't have been hard to remember who ordered what.
There is no visible restroom so we went next door to wash our hands at the cafe that we should have eaten at.
During part of our long way I stood outside because the two tables were occupied. An uncouth man and his little kids whizzed a football precariously close to my head and the parked cars.
The pizza was like one step above pizza made in a mid-90's high school home economics class. It was not good. We brought some slices to the beach with us and laughed when our daughter accidentally dropped slices in the sand. We were better off without it. (Yes we disposed of it properly because littering is not cool).
author: Kyle T.

description:
Simple math.

This Pascal equation is confusing: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pascal's_triangle

This Pasquale equation is impressive: Small (12") pie loaded with chicken and spinach was $14. Each of the loaded six slices could almost have been a meal themselves.

Fortunately was quite hungry after walking fifteen miles from the Marina to Parkside. Had no problem finishing each and every delicious bite.

As other yelpers note the place is small and more suited for takeout. But there is room inside for very friendly service and a much appreciated glass of water.

This is one math class you won't regret attending.
author: Jason B.

description: This best pizza I've had in SF, definitely recommend it after good walk at the San Francisco Zoo.
author: Danny B.

description: XL House Special with garlic and extra mushrooms. My favorite of all time. I can't get enough of this.
author: Rachel A.

description: Pizza was ok, they gave us a 45 minute time frame and it took almost 2 hours. Not worth the wait. Would maybe try again for pick up
author: Lana B.

description: What a dump! Dirty and in serious need of a remodel. If the pizza was good that could be overlooked, however, it was tasteless and the 2 guys working were extremely unfriendly.
author: Sam M.

description: I used to order from her on a regular basis but it's been a while. Total failure tonight and never again. I barely want to waste my time on this review after 2.5 hours and no pizza. I called 2 times checking up on it and the restaurant acted powerless to give me an ETA or reach the driver. I don't expect it to arrive, but I might offer the driver $5 if they try to deliver.
author: steve g.

description:
Came here with my friends after we walked to the beach for dinner. Right next door to Java house and across the street from the San Francisco Zoo. My friend wanted to eat here cause his old co-worker works here now and wanted to check it out. 

Small cozy place. My friend ordered the spaghetti with meat sauce pasta ($8.15) and I had the Beat ball sandwich ($6.80). They are probably known for their pizza's, but we didn't really feel like eating pizza. 

I would say they took there time cause I had to wait a while for a meat ball sandwich. I mean, how hard is it to make a meat ball sandwich?
author: Gen M.

description:
Love the pizza here! 
i usually get the Mushroom.Sausage. 
ONLY ONE DOWNSIDE.
the bottom tends to get soggy sometimes so prepare to have broken pizza, still taste amazing though. 

One tip to reheating pizza. i get a shallow pan and get a lid to cover the pizza completely so it can get crispy while getting the cheese melty! try it out!
author: Mike L.

description: They didn't even finish saying "please hold" before they put me on hold for 20 minutes. Worst customer service in existence. Also, I'm surprised the health department hasn't closed them down
author: Matthew A.

description:
We ordered a pizza to be delivered to us at work. The girl taking the order was a bit snarky, telling us it would be 45-60 for delivery. We are only just down the beach from them, but fine.
It arrived 75 minutes later and cold. We ate it because we were at work, what else could we do?
When I called this evening to ask about why it arrived cold they questioned why I was calling now, and why didn't i call when we discovered the pizza was cold.
Because we were at work, and it wasn't discovered cold until we got it inside, and we didn't have another 75 minutes to order and wait. 
Again, we were working!
The best they could do for us was to offer us a few free toppings on our next order.
On our next cold pizza order?
No thanks.
Never again
author: surf g.

description: Tried to order out for delivery from this place for dinner. They claimed they were out of everything, it seemed that they just didn't want to take our order. Won't be calling this place again.
author: David C.

description:
Great pizza for such a small place near the beach.  

Its a hidden jewel!  

I will definitely order here again and I might have to try their pastas/raviolis.
author: Liza B.

description: It's rare I ever want to say something positive about a pizza place in SF.  I'm a New York pizza kind of guy so California pizza usually isn't my thing.  But Pasquale's is a decent little almost New York pizza spot just blocks from the Zoo and the beach.
author: Ivan L.

description: This is by far the best pizza around and very affordable.  But, don't try to call and have a pizza delivered because they put you on hold and never come back.  When you hang up and call back they don't even listen to the caller they just tell you to hold again and don't come back.  Love this pizza but it's not worth the frustration.  I will go elsewhere.
author: Carolyn B.

description:
Nice pizza shop in a great location! While it is more ideal for take out, my friends and I decided to have a sit down meal here. It's pretty cramp but for just the three of us, it was fine. The people are very nice and we could watch them flipping dough and making our pizza right in front of us.

We had a customized pizza with sausage, mushrooms, bell peppers, and pesto sauce. It was pretty well made and tasted fine. 

http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?userid=z-hwsFeY66kqMVTMCp9w-A&select=QDSv-F-4EKhDG0PlXgthbw

I'd definitely come here again most likely ordering to go.  

4 stars.
author: Jonathan L.

description: The good news is, the pizza we ordered came super fast.  The bad news is, it wasn't cooked.  After pre-heating the oven and taking the time to cook it, it was decent enough I guess.  If I'm gonna have to cook my own delivery pizza, shouldn't it be cheap?  At $22 for medium, I expected a cooked pizza.
author: Elizabeth H.

description: We called our order in ahead of time and they totally messed it up. They refused to take responsibility for their mistake. They said we could order another pizza but it would take 20 mins. We will not be returning here
author: Stari N.

description:
We live nearby and I grew up on Pasquales pizza. I've always loved it but tonight, a Friday, I called to order - the phone picked up, I heard the background noise of the restaurant and then click - it seemed I was simply hung up on. So, I called back and a dude said "Pasquales, please hold, and he was gone. Now, I get that Friday nights can be busy but Pasquales on Sloat isn't exactly a dine-in place for Friday night dining so how busy could it be at the counter? I spent time tonight reading reviews because lately in the West Portal/Merced Manor area it seems no pizza place can get it right. I think the trouble with pizza is high employee turnover. 

So, I actually did order and was told 20 minutes. I arrived on time and then waited about 15 more minutes - my pie went in the oven while I was there. There were a few people waiting too but no more than two pies in the oven at a time that I could see. I paid and 2 other people came in and ordered. The phone only rang three times the whole time I was there (at 8:30 on a Friday night) but the guy making the pizzas seemed to be hustling as if it was busy. 

Then, I saw the young man at the register go straight to the food assembly line and grab some cheese with his bare hands and sprinkle it on someone's garlic bread to help. I got up from my chair, crossed the room, and told him that he cannot work the register and then handle food without washing his hands. I looked him straight in the eye and said, "I know you know that." To his credit, he looked contrite and had zero attitude. He said something to the cook in Spanish and they both looked over at me but neither had any attitude at all. He disappeared to the back and then came back up front and washed his hands at the sink. He looked scared. A few minutes later, I figured out why. An older man, who I assume is the owner, came in and began doing a few things. He never said a word, looked stern, and went about his business. I didn't have the heart to say anything because the register dude took the criticism well and I knew then he was a good kid. 

Unfortunately, they didn't connect that the small pizza they had made was for me so it went on top of the oven for a few minutes before they figured it out. I ordered 4 toppings and they missed one but they gave me my money back. The pizza was stretched a wee bit too thin so it collapsed and was wet in the center but it tasted good.The two stars were actually for the pizza. Delivery is way too slow. Order pick up. Personally, I think I jinxed myself by reading too many pizza reviews before ordering. Had I simply ordered blind, like I usually do, the universe probably would have given me a better experience. Sorry Yelp.
author: Chanel B.

description:
A bit on the drab side, but you can't beat the $5.00 personal pizzas. 

We were looking for something to eat while waiting to pick up my daughter from the zoo (just across the street), and this looked like a good place to grab a slice. No slices, but they mentioned that a personal pizza would only be 5 minutes to make. We ordered, and our pizza's arrived promptly, and piping hot. Once they cooled down, they turned out amazing -- on the thin side, but not too greasy. $5 for what was essentially 2 good-sized slices of pizza is a steal. The decor was pretty plain -- this is basically a take-out joint -- but the service was very friendly regardless.
author: Shannon C.

description: I was told this place had good pizza, so I thought I would try it out. Ordered a pizza for take out, employees were nice and wait time was short. But when I opened the box of the steaming hot pizza, I noticed right away that it was very greasy. The dough was stretched too far. All around not a very good pizza. Service was good though.  I guess I was given misinformation and went to the wrong restaurant location.  I was supposed to go to paqualles 2nd restaurant on 9th. But after trying this location, I might just pass on it.  I did hear Todos in San Bruno has great pizza, might give it a shot if I am feeling adventurous.
author: Aaron C.

description:
I am thoroughly rating on experience and flavor.

 We just went this past Sunday.....It was about 5pm Sept. 22nd, the weather was nice for San Fran. The place could of been swarming packed, given it's close proximity to the zoo, but it wasn't. WARNING: VERY LIMITED SEATING INSIDE. Standing counter space outside.

We had a 4 item pizza garlic, bell pepper, sausage and mushroom. Medium
OMG! Orgasmic good!!! It was heaven. I'm not sure if I have EVER had such a good pizza! On one hand it WAS Pricey compared with Round Table, but the quality and quantity of the ingredients was VERY DIFFERENT, so there was no comparison.

We got to watch these guys HAND THROW THE PIZZA CRUST! The sausage was real sausage and not those balls. The garlic -YUM!!! crushed and aplenty!!!!! The cheese (a given and not counted as an item) was bologna sized and at least as thick! The mushroom didn't turn into little curls in the oven.

Yes, it could of been easier to each if the pizza was in smaller pieces. I used my plastic fork under the piece to get it to my mouth. The SMELL OF GARLIC WAS HEAVENLY!
We paid $19.30 and in hind site maybe should of picked the 4 meat or Vegetarian, but didn't know the quality factor = quantity of ingredients would be as such. 

The bathroom was clean and decent, not the squalid, dirty place I had expected from the outside at all.

This place counts as Pasqualie's #2
Did I mention how QUICK our order came up?? For fresh? It doesn't get any better than this! Awesome.
Will we go back! Heck yes!!
author: Veronica L.

description: This pizza is exactly what pizza should be. Hot, crisp crust, melty delicious cheese.  plan to eat all that you order because once you start eating you won't be able to stop until its all gone! It's that good.
author: Shanda O.

description:
We just stopped in here tonight on a whim instead of driving on to the other pizza place we were planning on.

The people were super nice, the wait wasn't long, and I liked the casual slightly run-down feel of the place. It has its own parking lot which is super convenient.

That said, we did not care for the pizza. We had it with mushrooms and garlic and I'm not sure whether to blame the mushrooms (maybe they came from a can and weren't drained?) or the sauce (not reduced enough?), but the whole pizza just seemed water-logged. It's Halloween and i know that's a busy day for pizza places so maybe we'll give it another chance sometime, but this experience was pretty meh.
author: Amanda W.

description: They close at 10 pm. We came in at about 9:05 much to the displeasure of the girl at the register. They were already cleaning up the joint. We asked if they were closed and she said they were only doing to go orders. My fiancé ordered a salad and I asked for a meatball sub but they didn't have meatballs. I didn't want to be a jerk and order a pizza but I should have.  I ended up getting a salami sub. While we were waiting at the table they turned off some of the lights in the restaurant. In took about 25-30 minutes for a sub and salad. We were listening to one of the cooks and the girl at the register bicker about some personal issues they were having... Awkward!
author: Hector V.

description: i fucking love pizza.  how could anyone not love greasy, cheesy goodness?!  pasquales has a great crust--not too thick and not so thin that it tastes like a cracker.  Their red sauce is great, but get pesto instead!  especially if you get the charbroiled chicken special!!!  definitely call in your order, they get busy and there isn't a whole lot of seating inside.
author: Jen D.

description: Just picked up a meatball sandwich and pizza from Pasquale's on Sloat.  The meatball sandwich is so bad it is inedible. The sandwich was thrown together. The bread is so soggy the sandwich can not even be picked up. I'm even going to post a picture of this catastrophe. The management should be embarrassed to put a product like this out.
author: Seth W.

description:
My family and I were staying at a nearby hotel it was late and we hadn't had dinner yet so we took a short walk to this hidden gem and to our surprise it was f-ing amazing!!! Employes were super friendly. Fresh ingredients. It was perfect! 
Now every time we're in San Fran we have to stop here for some pizza.
author: Klarissa S.

description:
Hi,
Just ordered for pick up and online prices NEED TO BE UPDATED!!!   We were quoted apx $4 more for a pizza :-(
author: Barbara C.

description: Straight fire! Didn't want gooey round table pizza at work on this sunday,so I ordered from here.  Honestly the only reason I tried it was because of the dog statue outside lol!  But damn its hella good!!  The pizza is on the thinner side but feels thick if that makes sense.  I got a medium and was full off three slices, wow!  Cheese you can tell is real cheese and not weak pre shredded crap!  Cheese is thick and gooey and the toppings are fresh as can be!  I love this pizza it is soooo damn good!
author: Tavis I.

description: We used to order from the old Fulton Street location 25 years ago.  Great memories of days past.  This particular spot on Sloat is my absolute favorite.  It's very small and rundown looking with just a few tables.  Nothing beats ordering fresh from the counter and eating in.  I always order a sausage/mushroom combination.  What make me love this pizza so much is their sauce.  You can taste a hint of wine and it just hits the spot.  One of my all-time favorites!!
author: Alvin J.

description:
We came here after a day @ the Beach......ordered 2 large pizzas (Hawaiian & combo). We all loved it! Both Pizzas were gone in 10 minutes. They DONT skimp you on your toppings and its REALLY cheesy. Nice & friendly Service. It's a small joint, but we were all able to sit down & enjoy our Pizza.

Enjoyed watching them flip the dough & create our pizzas!!

This is the spot to come to after a Day @ the Beach!!

*~to the Cashier/server: thanks again for the drinks & Enjoy your time in the Military! Be safe!!
author: Leilani V.

description: Horrible !!! Have been a customer for decades.  Just had the most disgusting food in my entire life .  The crust was black there was no cheese and very few mushrooms.  Pasquale's was a San Francisco institution .  Raise your prices but produce quality.  It is so sad to see this restaurant fail.  I will never go back.
author: Ann T.

description:
4 stars - Pizza
2 stars - Service

I would have given them 4 stars because I do like their pizza. However, the service at this location is always unpredictable. On lesser occasions, I get good service. But the majority of the time that I've ordered for take out from this Pasquale's, I've always received poor service. Some of the front end workers are just very inconsiderate and have poor customer service skills. 

One day, bf calls to place an order for pick up. It might have been 11:55am (they open at 12pm). Someone picks up the call, so bf asked if he could place his order. The worker stated...and I heard it because he was on speaker..."Oh, we're not open yet man, can you call back in like 5 minutes?" Like really dude?! Why even pick up the phone if you're not going to take the order? They lost a customer that day. Another day, I come in to pick up an order that bf had already placed. I was coming from Oakland and East Bay/bridge traffic that day, so I didn't want any bs. When I get to the counter, the worker asked who's name it was under. I told her it was under ****. She replied, "Oh, we must have given that pizza to the last person who came in. We'll make another one right away." How would you make that mistake? They lost a customer that day too. Another day (I know, I know...and we still choose to come back), bf places an order for one pizza and the person on the phone gave him the total before even asking if he wanted anything else. He was going to order another pizza by the way. That time was a little more forgiving. If it weren't for the convenience and the pizza, we wouldn't come here anymore.
author: Marie T.

description:
The kid sister location of the other Pasquales offers similar menu items, but with a more stripped down atmosphere.

Basically, we only go to this location if we are seriously craving Pasquales after a zoo visit, and anticipate that there won't be parking at the location on Irving.

Essentially, this location offers 4-6 seats total, no ventilation or air conditioning, and features a wait staff comprised of teenagers texting while bringing drinks to your table.

Still-food quality is comparable to the other locations, and always hits the spot!
author: Monica B.

description:
Good local pizzeria.

Good family joint. Pizza is thin and the crust is unique. You can tell they use fresh ingredients from the smell of your pizza pie and the taste.

That's a spicy meatball!

My favorite part is the seasoning they use. Very distinct and unique to Pasq. A real Italian type of spot. Good anti-pasta and salads as well. Back in the day my family used to order from here all the time. Pizza night is no more, but I always slide through for the memories.
author: Phil H.

description: The pizza was okay but the service honestly ruined the whole thing for me. We walked in an hour and a half before they closed and  the employees were so rude, glaring at us the whole time like we were just a bother to them and refused to serve anything other then pizza. They were also out of tons of condiments and pizza toppings. Was not please with this place
author: Ashley A.

description:
Pasquale's is actually my favorite pizza in SF. Yeah, their crust is really bland and is most of the time overcooked, but the toppings are great and get it with extra cheese and you'll be in pizza heaven. 

This location is just as good as the Irving location, but it definitely doesn't offer all of the things that the Irving place offers. Sloat location is just pizza. No bottled sodas either. Just fountain soda. But the pizza is great and this is closer to my house. 

This location also has a little parking lot that fits about 3-4 cars, so no parking worries like you'd have with the Irving location.
author: Jen D.

description: Been coming here for years and their medium garliz pizza IS THE BOMB!!!  I prefer this size becasue the ratio of pizza crust, sauce, and topping(garlic!) is perfecto!  Their crust is always so crispy and yummy; sauce is flavorful. and cheese is very good.  Something with the way they do their pizza with olive oil makes this so super tasty!
author: Lucky P.

description: I would have to say I usually order pizza from this place and it's usually good but lately I have ordered and the service has not been so good. I decided to give them one last try tonight. When The pizza arrived it was missing toppings. I persisted to call back the restaurant and told them what I have ordered and that it was missing toppings. Whoever answered the phone persisted on telling me that it was my fault that I had never ordered that to my surprise. Then he told me that he didn't charge mefor the topping that I asked for. It just doesn't make sense to me for a small business to want to lose a customer over a pizza topping good luck in your future business. I used to like this place they have gone super downhill. They also need work on their delivery drivers the gentleman if I should call him a gentleman who came to my door was nothing but rude and gave smug looks I still ended up tipping him which I soon regretted.
author: Thomas S.

description:
We have been let down by Brothers and North Beach lately. Noriega does not deliver, so that was out. We decided to try Pasquale's, Frankly since they painted the facade once Java Beach went in, it looks much cleaner and nicer. 

Ordered sausage, onion and mushroom. The sauce is really good, you can taste the herbs like oregano and fennel. The red sauce is really good. The toppings seemed fresh and the crust was well cooked, yet crispy. Yes there were slightly charred parts which I liked.
author: Amanda L.

description:
This place is seriously terrible. 
The sauce tastes like plain tomato sauce out of a can. 
The cheese is so terrible that I began pulling it off of the pizza by my second piece so that I could manage to choke down another piece or two because I was starving. 
I would rather eat a frozen pizza that has been left out overnight and repeatedly run over by a garbage truck than eat there again. 
Somehow, the service was actually worse than the food.
author: Derek E.

description: A bit pricey for pizza. Otherwise they would be a four star. The pizza is good. the ambiance is not. However, if you are like me, you don't stick around to eat it, you take it home. The ingredients seem fresh and of good quality. If you ask for extra of a topping they take that to heart. The thing came out three inches high!
author: William P.

description:
I haven't actually had a pizza here from here in who knows how many years (way before Yelp), but I've tried. I gave up on this place and just order from the one on Irving., There has always been some problem why I couldn't get a delivery such as they're out of a topping or simply (inexplicably) not delivering. 
One night, we ordered a salad with anchovies and a pizza.  A few minutes later we got a call from the restaurant, that they were out of anchovies. How can you run out of anchovies? It may not be a high demand item but canned fish lasts virtually forever. There really is no excuse for running out, especially in an Italian restaurant. 
So we canceled the order with Sloat and put it in with Irving.
 Another evening I tried to place an order for delivery and was told rather bluntly, "No". It wasn't late either. 
Thank goodness for their other location.
author: Sleepy T.

description:
What are up with all the different Italian eateries and pizza places in this neighborhood?! It's really hard to tell what is a good place to eat at and what's just average. For me going to all these different places for many years have got me thinking about quality more so than quantity. This is actually one of the most underrated places in the city. I know that there are tons of choices around but I like simple best. The dining area isn't decorated much in any way, and tables are laid out just like in any other joint but I can tell when quality is in action. The workers who put so much time and effort into their pies have an area for everyone to see what goes on so that there are no questions on people cheating on the ingredients. I always enjoy ordering thin crust pizza here as it always reminds me of authentic style pizza.

My friends come here every so often because we find that we never have any problems here whatsoever. At times I want to give this place 5 stars but I will save that for another time. The only thing I can say is that the service can be hit or miss sometimes. If the place is empty expect speedy reliable service. If the place is packed, expect a wait. I don't mind the latter but sometimes I prefer a quick meal while not having to worry about waiting 30-45 minutes. Regardless of that being said this is a place to come to for a good time and a good price as well.
author: Jason Y.

description:
One of my all time favorite pizza places! I've had pizza all over the world, from Paris & Italy to the States. This is a good pizza place. We stop by here whenever we go to the Ocean Beach. They have one here in the Sacramento area that my whole familly loves as well.

Great Pizza!
author: Catherine D.

description: The Pasquale's on Sloat is about as far as you can get to the edge of the city without getting sand in your shoes.  There is no ambiance, don't even think of putting your elbows on that sticky table top--you may never get out.  Definitely take-out; better yet, they only charge $1 for delivery (at least to Daly City).  So the best thing about Pasquale's is the House Special.  After all, in a place like this that's really all that matters.
author: Joc V.

description:
It's more like 3.35 stars. 

We order from Pasquale's on Sloat because it's the best pizza in our delivery area.   At any given time there will be a Pasquale's box in our recycling.

Cheese pizza is the best - the crust has a good texture (not too chewy, not too crisp), the cheese is generous, the sauce is ok but a little bit acidic for me (slight tinny flavor).

Ham & pineapple is my second favorite.

The delivery people are very very very nice and the pizza usually arrives quickly.
author: Liz S.

description:
This review is STRICTLY based on the fact that I have never ate in the actual restaurant itself , I only order delivery from this place- and for PIZZA who the heck doesn't ?? So it makes sense.

Basically Pizza and Chinese food are the two foods you will never see me in the restaurant for... this is why they deliver. If I eat out and dine IN a restuarant I eat non deliverable food -- OBVIOUSLY -- and so should you. lol

So, Pasquale's is my second favorite Pizza place in San Francisco bra none ! (Milano's on 9th being my absolute favorite) -

Pasquale's on SLOAT pizza is very flavorful and ingrediants just POP in your mouth. The kind of flavor for pizza I am talking about is where you can actually taste the spices in the pepperoni, and actually taste the fennel in the sausage.... taste the tomato in the sause.. I mean seriously good authentic pizza here. Delivery is reasonable, and 
price is great for what you get.

The combination is really packed. The pesto is real, the meats are just awesome, and the veggies are fresh and real. Not no frozen taste here. Real size cuts of the veggies so you know they don't have that "cookie cutter" frozen food size to them.

Really a great pizza no matter what you order. The crust is perfect. Just chewy enough with out being to doughy, and just crispy enough for that real brick oven baked taste. The cheese is perfect, and perfect amounts of it as well. The pizza has that real "rolled on flour" taste on it. Unlike other places that are starting to use corn meal to roll the crust out on... When a pizza is really rolled out on a floured cutting board then hand tossed, you can tell.

And for my patented "Is It A Get Laid At The End Of The Night Place" review --------- Well,,, its delivery, so you probably JUST got laid before you ordered it !!. So honestly it is NOT one of those places.

But, all in all, the pizza is very impressive and you should try it. Highly recommended by me.

Disclaimer - I am only talking about the one on Sloat. I am not speaking of the other 2 in the city. As they are good too, I feel this one just has a better taste to it.
author: Joel D.

description: what's the benefit of pre ordering a pie over the phone !!! doesn't work when you get there and they start making the pizza in front of you !!! what's tops this vist off to tick me off was we paid when we walked in and gave a tip...then waited. " f" (forget about)their service and comunication !!!! i only gave them 1 star since 0 stars wasn't an option.
author: Angelo M.

description: Pasquale's on Sloat makes fantastic pizza.  It contends consistently for the top 1 and 2 of my favorite pizzas in San Francisco.  I've lived in the City since 2000, and I came from the East Coast.  I'm comparing to pizzas like Armand's in DC, if you're familiar.  I order delivery from Pasquale's all the time, and they never disappoint.  For my expectations, you can't get as good a New York style pizza anywhere else in San Francisco.  Of course, pizza preference is subjective, but for my money, I'll always call on Pasquale's.
author: Tim S.

description:
Been going to this restaurant since I was 5 years old.  I agree, unlike Zachary's, this restaurant is not one where you can hang out as it's too small.  They have like 4 tables in there or something like that.  However, as others have said, this restaurant is prime for take out orders as they only charge at most $2 for delivery charges if you're in the peninsula area (I think the farthest they go to is Daly City/South San Francisco).  They are quite fast with their delivery as well.

Now, the pizza. The crusts are pretty basic.  However their pizzas are outstanding.  They have pretty good deals if you want 2 large pizzas.  They also have occasional coupons in the ads so look out for those.  

Overall, I love this place.  Should have gotten 1 more star but it's one dimensional in the fact that you can't dine their like other pizza joints.  However, I've been going there for about 2 decades now so it gives you an idea of what kind of pizza place this, or I'm just someone with bad taste who happens to not like change =P.  I'd like to believe the former.
author: Joe V.

description: i've been coming here for years mainly for pickup. It's much tastier if you pick it up and take it directly home to eat rather than have it delivered. Its very good and plenty of cheese and toppings and extremely reasonable , i am a little surprised that a few reviewers said it was very expensive ,its not. Yes the place does look kind of dumpy but it always has appeared clean and all the ingredients are fresh and their sausage is very good, i'm getting hungry just thinking about it .
author: Biggwally K.

description:
3.5 stars... always get take out and they deliver to DC which is a plus!!  Not 4 stars cause their pizza is not consistent. there are times the crust is to die for, not soggy, great flavor, thick just the way i like it, but then there are time it is soaked with grease and gets all soggy... but overall the pizza is great!!  We love the delivery guy... always smiling when he drops off the pizza.
My favorite: mushrooms, onions and sausage on thick crust
would be nice if they had chicken, but they dont...
author: Shelley N.

description: Basic pizza that tastes good without breaking the bank
author: Cassandra C.

description:
We love Pasquale's Pizza! great for families and the food and pizza are so good!  This is the place to come and eat the real thing.
Leti P
author: Letizia P.

description:
You've tried them all, now try ...

It was their ad hype that led me into their joint. No, not led, forced me to make it my first pizza joint in SF (newly arrived).

Their sausage was pretty stand-out; a nice a sweet fennel note to it. The crust was nice but the sliced mozza made me think of kraft singles and undoubtedly tainted my experience.  Fresh mushrooms though, gotta appreciate that.

Overall an average pie that should satisfy East Cost tastes but will leave those who've experienced wood-fired goodness scratching their heads.
author: david r.

description:
Mmmmm...meatball sandwich.  You like the sauce huh?

This little joint near the zoo was deserted when I visited it on a Tuesday at 1:00 except for one worker-girl who was busy chatting with two sketchy lookin' dudes.  The scene reminded me a bit of something from Deliverance; what with the sketchers and no one around.  

Worker-girl dropped the conversation and took my order promptly and got to work.  5 minutes or so later she handed me a fat, juicy, cheesy meatball sandwich on a roll with most tasty sauce.

I'd give em a 5, but for the empty place and sketchers.

I'll be chowin' here again, but probably on a weekend when I have more witnesses around.
author: Kash-money K.

description:
The place is pretty old. I've NEVER seen anyone actually eat in the place, seems like now its basically take-out and delivery, though you might be able to eat there if you wanted.

Almost always there are 2 guys and a girl working there. The girl handles all orders (in person and on phone) and can seem short. Communicating with her can sometimes be a challenge, but dont let that turn you off. The 2 guys are behind the counter making pizza, so you could watch if you want (idk why you would).

On to the food. The first time I ate there, I ordered a pizza with extra cheese. WOW sooooo much cheese, basically too much. I almost always order extra cheese when I eat pizza, but at Pasquale's they use a lot of cheese to begin with!
I've since eaten there multiple times and I'd have to agree with Shelly G, in that its not consistent. On the lower side its basically just a typical pizza place, but on the high side its definately above average. Its never spectacular, but it serves its purpose as a pizza place here deep in the outer sunset.

Basically I wouldnt tell anyone that they have to eat here, but if you're looking for a pizza place out here its pretty good. Its definately on my rotation of pizza places.
author: Josh S.

description:
My cred:  lived for 30+ years in chicago... eating pizza all the time :)

this is the best thin crust pizza in SF.   At most places in SF, the thin crust is more like pan.... its thick and doughy.....  however pasqualies knows whats up.  i think the cheese is a blend.... its def high quality.... and its THIN.   

only suggestion i would have is to cut the pizza in squares so it is more sturdy.....  

thanks for making the best pie in SF.
author: Johnny C.

description:
I always drive by this place on my way to great highway, so my friend and I decided one day to just stop and try the place out. 

This place is pretty old and there was like no people eating in there and you could watch the people make your pizza, if that is what you want.

The pizza I would give it about 3-3.5 stars, it isn't the best I've ever had but definitely solid. It was really weird one half of the pizza crust was nice and crispy and other half was kinda soggy, which is weird because we ate there, but the crispy side was just delicious. I'd come back here if i had the chance just to see if their pizza would be consistent. (With the non soggy part of course).
author: Pat T.

description:
I simply love this place. I been going here for about 18 years.

My family members actually told me about this place... They used to bring me to the restaurant on Irving (don't know if they're connected) also. 

My earliest memory of this place was with my uncle... he brought me to the zoo and we ate here for lunch... That was when the doggy diner was still there...

Overall, I gave this place 4 stars because they deliver to Daly City and the crust is good.
author: Fred P.

description:
if you're leaving the SF Zoo hungry in the late afternoon, here is your food option:  Pasquale's.

i'm never NOT in the mood for pizza, so me and the boy came in and decided to get a small pizza.  now my favorite pizza in the world is pesto, pineapple, jalapeño pizza (trust me, if you get it done at the right spot, you will fall for it) and i'd only ever had it made truly amazingly @ Napoli Pizza in the TL.  until this day @ pasquale's.  they had the three toppings and agreed to make us the pizza.

first of all, for the first time EVER, someone looked at me when i mentioned those three toppings, intended for ONE pie, and said "wow, that sounds really good." -- already, i was like "whoa! someone who doesn't ask me to repeat myself!"  so after the girl took our order we sat and waited.

nothing else to say but they hit the nail on the head spot on, giving napoli a run for their... well, pizza skills, i guess.

i've never had anything else here so i can't review this place on the regular ol' slice-o'-cheese merit, but 5 stars go to them (a) for being there when my boyfriend and i were ravenously hungry and there was nothing else around, (b) for making my pizza without giving me lip or looking at me like i was nuts; and (c) for throwing together my ultimate combo in just the right way.

cheers.  i will go and try the irving location because it's close to home and if they can whip up my yummy concoction as good as these guys did, i'll frequent the joint.
author: Beccie F.

description: Ok I'm writing a review from my childhood memories because that was the last time I came to this Pasquales. My parents loved ordering from this pizza place, I remember sitting in this tiny place watching the man toss the pizza and top it with a bunch of toppings while I drool waiting to eat it! Crust was thick and toppings overflowed, thanks for the good memories and delicious pizza!
author: Karen T.

description:
It's not from New york, but if you order specifically: Thin crust, light on the sauce an galric on your pizza, you're almost there. If you shut your eyes...

That's as close as i've gotten in this city.

Chicago deep dish- well that's another story- but it's not here.
author: Rich V.

description: If i could give Pasquale's less than one star, i would.  A year ago we had a late night walk with my hubby, and ordered pizza from the Sloat place. Pizza was slimy and literally slid off the crust, which was soggy right out of the oven.  Even store bought would have been better and cheaper.  If they are so good as other reviewers say, then they must have disliked us or something, cuz they sure made us a sh..ty pizza.
author: Illiena V.

description: This Pasquale's location is small and just sell pizza. The menu is not the same as the one on Irving. A couple of chairs and tables to eat at.  Probably best to go here for takeout. The pizza also tastes different from Irving. Sauce and topping seem to be different. Overall still good but as mentioned Irving is better.
author: Keoni U.

description: My favorite pizzeria in San Francisco. What makes this pizza great is its toppings. My favorite is pepperoni, mushroom and sausage. They use real italian sausage here. The crust is ok. Tip the pizza maker a couple bucks and your pizza will be covered in the toppings you want, you won't be able to see the cheese underneath. Pasquale's Pizza in my house never lasts longer than the next day. Don't expect to dine into this place though, they have 3 small tables and it is quite boring inside unless you love watching pizzas being made.
author: D J.

description: I was despairing that the way of the pizza was going down the ultr-chunky crust, soggy cheese route until we decided to revisit Pasquale's in the Sunset. Their piping hot pizza was delicious, and I would recommend their house special and meat eater pizzas. I wasn't entirely thrilled with the chicken pizza as the tomato base was yummy but the chicken itself was almost so dry it was like jerky. Per the other reviewers, I wouldn't eat here on site, since the dining space is so tiny and there is no ambiance to speak of. Overall, a good solid pizza joint if you stick with the staples.
author: Rebecca C.

description: The main thing is the service was quite bad on the side of intrusiveness.  The waiter negotiated with us about what appetizer/salad we would choose, stopped in on us to provide extra napkins and tidbits every three minutes or so, and- a pet peeve of mine- came by the table twice while we determined the check.  He also seemed to come by every time someone was about to say something scandalous (and fun)!  But I believe his intentions were good.  We negotiated into getting a mixed salad (fine, mediocre), got some burned bread, and a pizza that was cooked too quickly and at two high a temperature (so the dough was undercooked and the crust and bottom burned)- vegetables thrown on haphazardly.  The atmosphere was fine, the carafe of wine was watered down but a good deal, and I felt they were trying hard to be so good.  I would only go there again if I were drunk.
author: Melissa W.

description: Tried this place for the first time. Cheese was good, sauce was good.. but the pizza dough was like cardboard. Very dry and very tough to chew. By the end I was just eating the cheese off and leaving the pizza (hey I was hungry).. so it's okay, but there's gotta be better out there. Thumbs up the the fast delivery,  just wish it was worth it.
author: Hilary C.

description: you know you're beyond fuckin lazy when you are 2 short blocks away and ask for delivery. you know a place is damn busy delivering when your pizza takes 45 mins to arrive from 2 short blocks away. but anyhow. Pasquale's is an old neighborhood standby w/ terrific pizza every single time. when I was experimenting with low carb and ordered the ultra thin crust pizza, the lovely generous toppings were sludging all over the place except into my mouth. so stick to the normal crust which isn't too doughy or thick anyway. they are great about making a half this/half that pie that is always accurate so nobody can bitch. and at Pasquale's, an x-large is TRULY an extra large -- yay for a last honest pizzeria
author: Prima D.

description: My friends and I love this place. It smells wonderful, is open late and you can get ravioli just as easy as a slice of pizza.
author: R E.

description: Solid pizza.  Probably my second favorite place for pizza in SF (quite a few tie).  Favorite is the sausage and pepperoni.  What distinguishes this pizza is how good the sausage is and how it complements the pepperoni.    Sure the decor isn't there on Sloat, but who cares?  It's good pizza to pick up and run or just eat after a cold surf...  Crust runs slightly thicker than its Irving Street counterpart but that's part of the attraction; it's a real meal.  I'd highly recommend this place for takeout at the least.  Dependable and tasty.
author: A D.
